{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with left-sided weakness after a chiropractic neck manipulation, and the MRI shows a left C5 hemicord lesion. Based on this information, the most likely finding in this patient would be contralateral corticospinal tract involvement. This is because the corticospinal tract carries motor fibers that decussate in the medulla, so a lesion on the left side of the spinal cord would affect the motor fibers originating from the right side of the brain.", "answer_choice": "C"}
